conversation.text: Hello! I'm going to help teach you how to cook tuna steak!
Where do I start?
First off - mix 2T of lemon juice with 1 T of olive oil.
evidence: Mix the juice, oil, garlic, and thyme in a sealable bag

conversation.text: I mixed the lemon juice and olive oil.
Add 2 cloves of garlic and 2 t of thyme
evidence: Then, add 2 minced cloves of garlic and 2 teaspoons (1.5 g) of minced fresh thyme or 1/2 teaspoon (1 g) of dried thyme

conversation.text: Should i chop or mince them?
You will mince them!
evidence: minced cloves of garlic
minced fresh thyme

conversation.text: Okay. I finished that. Can i move on to the next step?
Do you have all the ingredients in the bag?
evidence: Press out the air and seal the bag tightly. You can shake the marinade around to combine the ingredients

conversation.text: Yes I have them all in there.
Now you are going to seal the bag and shake to combine the ingredients
evidence: Press out the air and seal the bag tightly. You can shake the marinade around to combine the ingredients

conversation.text: Should I have a lot of air in the bag?
Do you have the air  out of it?
I pushed it all out.
Then you are doing it right!
evidence: shake the marinade

conversation.text: Can I go on to the next step?
Add the tuna steaks and place them in the refrigerator.
evidence: Add the tuna steaks and refrigerate them for up to 30 minutes.

conversation.text: Do I put them in the bag? And how long do I have them in there?
Add 4 steaks into the bag. You will chill them for less than 30 minutes.
evidence: refrigerate them for up to 30 minutes.
t 4 tuna steaks that are around 1 inch (2.5 cm) thick and put them in the bag

conversation.text: Great! What do I do in the meantime?
Heat your gas grill to a medium-high heat.
evidence: If you're using a gas grill, turn the burners to medium-high.

conversation.text: Okay! What is next?
Take the steaks out of the bag. Add some salt and pepper.
evidence: Take the steaks out of the bag and season them with salt and pepper

conversation.text: How much should I add?
Add 1/4 t of each. Then use a paper towel dipped in oil to oil the grill.
evidence: 1/4 teaspoon (1.5 g) of salt
1/4 teaspoon (0.5 g) of ground peppe

conversation.text: Great! Can i add the steaks now?
Yes! Lay them out so they are not touching. You will grill them for 3-4 minutes
evidence: ay the 4 tuna steaks onto the grill grate so the steaks aren't touching and close the lid.

conversation.text: Do I flip them?
Yes! Then you will grill them for another 3 to 4 minutes
evidence: Flip the tuna steaks and grill them for another 3 to 4 minutes
Put the lid back on and finish cooking the tuna steaks for another 3 to 4 minutes.

conversation.text: Do I have more to do?
Just let them rest for 5 to 10 minutes to cool.
evidence: rest them for 5 to 10 minutes

conversation.text: What should I serve with it?
It pairs well with grilled vegetables, couscous, or a garden salad.
evidence: grilled vegetables,
couscous,
a garden salad

conversation.text: Great! I think I am all done!
Congratulations! You have successfully completed this cooking task.
Thanks for your help!

procedure.summary: Mix the juice, oil, garlic, and thyme in a sealable bag.
procedure.description: Open a large bag and pour in 2 tablespoons (30 ml) of lemon juice along with 1 tablespoon (15 ml) of olive oil. Then, add 2 minced cloves of garlic and 2 teaspoons (1.5 g) of minced fresh thyme or 1/2 teaspoon (1 g) of dried thyme. Press out the air and seal the bag tightly. You can shake the marinade around to combine the ingredients. If you prefer, use your favorite marinade or just season the tuna with oil, salt, and pepper.

procedure.summary: Add the tuna steaks and refrigerate them for up to 30 minutes.
procedure.description: Get out 4 tuna steaks that are around 1 inch (2.5 cm) thick and put them in the bag with the garlic herb marinade. Seal the bag and then turn the bag over a few times so the tuna steaks are coated. Avoid marinating the tuna steaks for more than 30 minutes or the acidic lemon juice could make them become mushy.

procedure.summary: Heat a gas or charcoal grill to medium-high.
procedure.description: If you're using a gas grill, turn the burners to medium-high. If you're using a charcoal grill, fill a chimney with briquettes and light them. Dump the briquettes onto 1 side of the grill once they're hot and lightly covered with ash.Variation: If you'd rather broil the tuna, turn the broiler to "High" and place the tuna about 4 inches (10 cm) below the heating element. Then, broil the tuna for 3 to 4 minutes on each side. If you're using a broiler, preheat it for at least 5 minutes before cooking the tuna steaks.

procedure.summary: Take the steaks out of the bag and season them with salt and pepper.
procedure.description: Remove the marinated tuna steaks from the refrigerator and transfer them from the marinade to a plate. Then, sprinkle 1/4 teaspoon (1.5 g) of salt and 1/4 teaspoon (0.5 g) of ground pepper over the steaks. Discard the marinade once you remove the tuna steaks from the bag.

procedure.summary: Oil the grill grate and lay the tuna steaks on it.
procedure.description: Dip a paper towel in a little vegetable oil and gather it into a ball. Grip the balled up paper towel with tongs and brush the towel over the grill grates so they're lightly greased. Lay the 4 tuna steaks onto the grill grate so the steaks aren't touching and close the lid. If you're using a charcoal grill, you can put the tuna steaks directly over the coals.

procedure.summary: Grill the tuna for 3 to 4 minutes.
procedure.description: Set a timer so you don't accidentally overcook 1 side of the tuna steaks. They should become browned on the bottom side that's exposed to the heat.

procedure.summary: Flip the tuna steaks and grill them for another 3 to 4 minutes.
procedure.description: Once the tuna steaks are halfway cooked, carefully lift the lid and use tongs to flip each steak over. Put the lid back on and finish cooking the tuna steaks for another 3 to 4 minutes. The tuna should be a little flaky near the edges, but slightly pink in the center. Plan on grilling the tuna steaks for around 8 minutes total if you'd like medium-rare fish. If you want them cooked medium, add an extra 1 to 2 minutes to the grilling time. Avoid cooking the tuna steaks beyond medium since the steaks will become dry and crumbly if they're overcooked.

procedure.summary: Remove the tuna steaks and rest them for 5 to 10 minutes before serving.
procedure.description: Use tongs to carefully transfer the tuna steaks from the grill to a serving platter. Let the steaks rest while you get side dishes ready. Consider serving grilled tuna steaks with grilled vegetables, couscous, or a garden salad. Refrigerate leftover tuna steaks in an airtight container for up to 3 to 4 days.
